title: Lakers' Anthony Davis jokes he 'overstepped' his boundaries when recruiting Kawhi Leonard
text:
CLOSE USA TODAY Sports' Trysta Krick and Mark Medina break down the questions entering this season for the Los Angeles Lakers. USA TODAY

EL SEGUNDO, Calif. – Perhaps Anthony Davis should not have talked with Kawhi Leonard about joining the Los Angeles Lakers. Then, maybe Leonard would’ve chosen the Lakers instead of the LA Clippers.

“Somebody said he don’t really like all the recruitment and all that stuff, so I felt like I overstepped my boundaries,” Davis said, with a chuckle. “But it was a fun process. I would do it all over.”

The Lakers still enter the 2019-20 NBA season with championship aspirations partly because they acquired Davis from the New Orleans Pelicans shortly before the draft.

When they face the Clippers at Staples Center on Tuesday (10:30 p.m. ET, TNT), the Lakers may also wonder what could have been.

Perhaps the Lakers could have had a "Big Three" with LeBron James, Davis and Leonard, while the Clippers would have had a team filled with role players. After all, the Clippers signed Leonard partly because they also acquired Paul George from Oklahoma City for Shai Gilgeous- Alexander, Danilo Gallinari and a handful of draft picks.

Instead, the Lakers and Clippers face off in what could become the beginning of an intra-city rivalry.

“I’m not surprised by anything really. But I also don’t get too excited,” James said. “I don’t get too excited until things actually happen. But I thought we had a chance. That’s all you can ask for. ...

"When he went to the Clippers, I thought that was just as cool. It was great for our league, and he had to do what was best for him. And we all respect that.”

James and Davis still plan to talk with Leonard before the game. James said he will not revisit with Leonard his free-agency destination, joking, “Kawhi doesn’t talk to you guys.” James has become much more illuminating with reporters. When it came to detailing his recruiting efforts with Leonard, however, James said that “we don’t really talk about what happens on my phone.”

Anthony Davis and LeBron James tried to woo Kawhi Leonard to the Lakers. (Photo: Ethan Miller, Getty Images)

The Lakers hosted a meeting this summer with Leonard at an L.A. hotel featuring president Jeanie Buss and general manager Rob Pelinka. Leonard also met separately with Magic Johnson, even though he stepped down as the Lakers’ president of basketball operations before the regular season ended.

Leonard may have become irked that details emerged about the Lakers’ recruiting efforts, while the Clippers operated stealthily. Yet, Leonard has said he became more intrigued with teaming up with George in hopes of delivering the Clippers their first NBA championship. Though George will miss possibly the first 10 games of the season after having surgery on his left shoulder, an NBA.com survey revealed the majority of the league’s general managers pin the Clippers as favorites to win the league title. Three of five USA TODAY Sports panelists tapped the Clippers.

“He can do whatever he wants, obviously,” Davis said. “We thought that we had a chance but he made a decision and we’re going to face him tonight. He’s a hell of a player, they’ve got a great team over there so it should be fun.”

Follow USA TODAY Sports NBA writer Mark Medina on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
description: LeBron James and Anthony Davis tried to woo Kawhi Leonard to Los Angeles to play for the Lakers. He moved to LA, but joined the Clippers instead.
